intro: Clibadium pileorubrum, commonly known as the red-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution in its native habitat.
